net.corda.core.crypto

Class CompositeKey.Builder

  • net.corda.core.crypto.CompositeKey.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    CompositeKey

    public static class CompositeKey.Builder

    A helper class for building a class CompositeKey.Node.

    See Also:
    class CompositeKey.Node

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder()
      A helper class for building a class CompositeKey.Node.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompositeKey.Builder addKey(CompositeKey key, int weight)
      Adds a child class CompositeKey node. Specifying a weight for the child is optional and will default to 1.
      CompositeKey.Builder addKeys(net.corda.core.crypto.CompositeKey keys) 
      CompositeKey.Builder addKeys(java.util.List<? extends net.corda.core.crypto.CompositeKey> keys) 
      CompositeKey.Node build(java.lang.Integer threshold)
      Builds the class CompositeKey.Node. If threshold is not specified, it will default to the size of the children, effectively generating an "N of N" requirement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder()

        A helper class for building a class CompositeKey.Node.

        See Also:
        class CompositeKey.Node

    • Method Detail

      • addKey

        public CompositeKey.Builder addKey(CompositeKey key,
                                   int weight)

        Adds a child class CompositeKey node. Specifying a weight for the child is optional and will default to 1.

        See Also:
        class CompositeKey

      • addKeys

        public CompositeKey.Builder addKeys(net.corda.core.crypto.CompositeKey keys)

      • addKeys

        public CompositeKey.Builder addKeys(java.util.List<? extends net.corda.core.crypto.CompositeKey> keys)

      • build

        public CompositeKey.Node build(java.lang.Integer threshold)

        Builds the class CompositeKey.Node. If threshold is not specified, it will default to the size of the children, effectively generating an "N of N" requirement.

        See Also:
        class CompositeKey.Node
